<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 11+"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Energy-Absorbing](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1763)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Kingmaker</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Kingmaker Companion Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=151) pg. 104</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

As with [_energy-resistant_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=283) runes, these runes convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain 5 resistance to [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27), [electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), or [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72). The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple _energy-absorbing runes_ can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different type. When an _energy-absorbing rune_ provides resistance to damage from a foe's attack or ability, the armor itself appears to become infused with that energy, be it dripping with acid, riming over in frost, crackling with lightning, or flickering with flames. This effect does not inflict damage itself and ends at the start of your next turn, or as soon as you take the following reaction.
